pr_title: Simplify constant conditions and constant variables

timeline.message: Simplify constant conditions and constant variables

timeline.bodyText: event cannot be null because it is already checked and initialized in event = ensureLoggingEvent(event);
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: OrderPreservingBase64.decode cannot return null.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: private static final String THROTTLING_MANAGER_SUFFIX = ".throttle"; so it cannot start with .dump.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: I think the original intent was the other way around, i.e. if THROTTLING_MANAGER_SUFFIX ends with ".dump" then the dump file should end in ".dump.". So please correct your fix.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText:
substring cannot return null.
req.getPathInfo() could return null but in our case it never does because it contains at least api/v0/.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: If the various endpoint paths are modified, api/v0 may disappear from them, modifying this check will then lead to an error which is not suitable.
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText:
So it still need to be fixed, as req.getPathInfo().substring(target.length()) could throw a NPE.
Fixing that.
replies.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Never used.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Always false. Used false instead in method calls to make that clear.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Should this be removed?
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Yes it should, but probably as part of a coherent PR removing all mentions of archive, including from Store interface method signatures.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: extractReadToken already takes care of invalid token and thus throws instead of returning null.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Previous while loop can only exit if !itermeta.hasNext().
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: writeTimestamp is always false.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Previous while loop can only exit if !itermeta.hasNext().
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText:
First time it is evaluated null == chunkenc so the second part is not evaluated.
After that, lastchunk is assigned to chunk, which is a long thus cannot be null.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: extractReadToken already checks that the token is valid and throw if its not instead of returning null
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: reader cannot be null in the try clause except for the last line, which cannot throw a IOException.
timeline.author: ftence
ftence
ftence

timeline.bodyText: Will throw NPE if the producer is not defined in the token.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Unused.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText:
Cannot happen because already checked before.
Before the PR change, could not happen either because a NPE would have been thrown.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: We're already in a if (!dryrun && doShuffle) so !dryrun is always true.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Unused.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Was reset to null at the end of each iteration of the while loop. Changed to variable defined in the loop instead.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: null == decoder was always true because decoder was reset to null  at the end of each iteration of the while loop.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: lastserver is always null.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: lastserver should be set to tokens[0] in the loop instead of removing the check.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: Is always null.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Cannot be null, checked and initialized just before.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: done is always true here so make it explicit.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Could never be true, fixes wrong boolean operator.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: macro is a Macro which is Snapshotable so this was only a null check.
timeline.author: ftence
ftence

timeline.bodyText: func is always null because of line above.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Macro is Snashotable so it is always false because taken care of by the condition above.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: As List is Iterable, only check Iterable.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Always true, else an error is thrown.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Remove unneeded test, add a comment to keep that clear.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Already taken care of by instanceof.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: We are in an else clause that make sure we have !encoders.isEmpty(), so no need to check that.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: If null != decoder then null == gts, make that explicit.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: If null == decoder, make that explicit.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Breaking here will make the test in the while useless. Remove the break and leave the while end.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Always true, else an error would have been thrown.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Macro case is never reached because already taken care of by the Snashotable one.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: metadata is always null, replaced by null.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: readable value is known for each call.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Agreed, but keeping readable in the calls makes understanding the code simpler when browsing it without an IDE which makes the parameter name explicit.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: Always true.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: LEVELDB_HOME is not in REQUIRED_PROPERTIES.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Always happen in the else clause.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText:
dr is initialized just above so null != dr is always true.
Also simplifying !a || a && b to !a || b.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: iter is a MetadataIterator so this is only a null check.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Make expose value explicit.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Make the value of metadata explicit.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: Never happens as modulus is initialized and is final.
timeline.author: ftence
ftence

timeline.bodyText:
startrow is always set to null or else return true; in the first part.
So the test null == startrow is always true and then startrow is reassigned to a new value.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: if hasLabel, then checkLabels because hasLabel can be true only if checkLabels

replies.bodyText: Maybe, but should we check the attributes? This is what checkAttributes determines, so it is not always true.

ftence

replies.bodyText: Then add it as a comment to make the understanding easier once the clause is removed.

timeline.message: Addressed PR comments, fixed symbols in url, more comments.
Add comments to make if/else clear
